title: Id this type in Luottokuntas logo
content:
Anyone know what type this is.  
 [http://www.luottokunta.fi](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201105958/http:/www.luottokunta.fi/ "http://www.luottokunta.fi")

here’s a bigger version

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201105958im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/luottokuntalogo_5236.jpg)

 [‹ Need typeface to pair with Univers](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201105958/http:/www.typophile.com/node/19463 "Go to previous forum topic") [Polish Book ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201105958/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38036 "Go to next forum topic")
author: kattttor

comments.content: I think someone had some fun with Eurostile Extended. Look at the K.

Actually I tihnk they took Eurostile Demi and stretched it a bit.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/eurostile/demi-63893/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201105958/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/eurostile/demi-63893/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/eurostile/demi-63893/")

That’s what designing a logotype implies: having fun with a typeface. (No use in not changing anything — makes it harder to copyright).

. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO
Just rememberd that I should pay my VISA bill, it’s in a Luottokunta envelope on my desk. :^P

I got my first VISA bill yesterday. First time I saw this logo was on that envelope. First time I was pleased getting a bill :D

I’d like my bills to have more sexy graphics on them.

FP Head is pretty nice, not as nice but ok.
It would take a lot more than a cool logo to make me pleased to get a bill.
